Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the violation of the island-wide curfew by stating that the mosque "summons a crowd" to attend.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the mosque violated the curfew and summoned a crowd.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the individuals gathered at the mosque were not following orders and were risking the lives of citizens, without providing concrete evidence of their intentions or actions.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation for the gathering at the mosque, stating that it was a medical gathering organized by medical professionals for COVID-19 testing.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact provided by the expert that the gathering at the mosque was a result of a misunderstanding and fear of the disease spreading, rather than intentional violation of the curfew.
Understate: It is difficult to determine if there is any understatement bias in this claim.
